text: Oswaldo Fumeiro Alvarez (21 August 1956 – 25 May 2020), more commonly known as Vadão, was a Brazilian football manager.espnbrasil.terra.com.br:Portuguesa He was head coach for the Brazil women's national football team. He was fired after the team lost the 2019 FIFA Women's World Cup in the 16th round. ==Death== Vadão died on 25 May 2020 from liver cancer in São Paulo, aged 63. ==Managerial statistics== J.League Data Site Team From To Record G W D L Win % Tokyo Verdy 2005 2005 Total ==References== ==Other websites== *Statistics Category:1956 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Brazilian football managers Category:Sportspeople from São Paulo (state) Category:Deaths from liver cancer
title: Vadão
